meanings.definition: Too vivid or intense in color or detail.
meanings.sent1: The overvivid painting hurt my eyes with its bright colors.
meanings.sent2: The sunset was overvivid, painting the sky in shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent3: The overvivid flowers in the garden seemed to glow unnaturally.
meanings.sent4: Her overvivid imagination made her see monsters in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The overvivid memory of the accident haunted him for years.

meanings.definition: Excessively vivid or realistic in description or portrayal.
meanings.sent1: The overvivid story made me feel like I was living in it.
meanings.sent2: The movie's special effects were overvivid, making it seem like real life.
meanings.sent3: His overvivid retelling of the fishing trip had us all in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The overvivid details in the book brought the characters to life in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The overvivid dream felt more real than waking life.
